title: Error when binutils in packages.yaml
body:
### Expected Result

With a `packages.yaml` containing

```
packages:
  binutils:
    paths:
      binutils@2.31.1 %clang@9.0.0-apple: /usr/local/Cellar/binutils/2.31.1
```

the commands `spack spec binutils` and `spack install binutils` should succeed.

### Actual Result

```
oxberry1@Uvalde:~/spack$ 3.2>spack spec binutils
Input spec
--------------------------------
binutils

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: packages.yaml entries cannot be virtual packages:
  in "/Users/oxberry1/.spack/packages.yaml", line 2, column 3: binutils
oxberry1@Uvalde:~/spack$ 3.2>spack install binutils
==> Error: packages.yaml entries cannot be virtual packages:
  in "/Users/oxberry1/.spack/packages.yaml", line 2, column 3: binutils
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Add external install of `binutils` to `packages.yaml`.

```console
$ spack spec binutils
$ spack install binutils # probably optional
```

### Information on your system

Using macOS 10.12.6, with a minimal `packages.yaml` shown above (my actual `packages.yaml` is longer), with spack at commit `f838b5e8c093b60916beb7d62d177301688088b2` (current with `origin/develop` at time of posting). Also tried https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/9007 rebased on top of `f838b5e8c093b60916beb7d62d177301688088b2`, so adding the latest version of `binutils` to spack did not resolve this issue.

-----
